quote-text:
Tension mounts at the apex of the clip, when a male peer of the girl rouses Lionel [Richie] from one of his reveries with the phrase, “Thereâs something going on in the sculpture class. I think you ought to check it out”. Dear God!, you think, already creeped out by this stage, and not just by the songâs minor key. Is she self-immolating as a public protest? Has she gone on a shooting rampage because she just canât take the harassment any more?!

No. Lionel enters the room, and there is the girl, a glazed over look in her eyes and a clay model of his head on a plinth, eerily reminiscent of Victorian death masks.

Here it is, along with Benjamin Disraeli’s for good measure.
